text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Liberec Region | native_name = Liberecký kraj | native_name_lang = cs | settlement_type = Region | image_skyline = Kotelní_jámy,_od_Zlatého_návrší_(03).jpg | image_flag = Flag of Liberec Region.svg | flag_size = | image_shield = Liberec Region CoA CZ.svg | shield_size = | image_map = Liberecký kraj in Czech Republic.svg | mapsize = | map_alt = | map_caption = | coordinates = | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = Czech Republic | seat_type = Capital | seat = Liberec | parts_type = Districts | leader_title = Governor | leader_name = | area_footnotes = | area_total_km2 = 3162.93 | elevation_m = | elevation_max_m = 1435 | elevation_min_m = | population_footnotes = | population_total = 442356 | population_as_of = 2019-01-01 | population_density_km2 = auto | iso_code = CZ-LI | registration_plate = L | website = www.kraj-lbc.cz }} Liberec Region is an administrative unit (kraj) of the Czech Republic. The capital city is Liberec. The region's landscape includes the Jizera Mountains, part of the Krkonoše Mountains and part of the Lusatian Mountains. Lake Mácha is near the town of Doksy. ==Administrative divisions== The Liberec Region is divided into 4 districts: ==References== Category:2001 establishments in Europe Category:Bohemia
title: Liberec Region
